allPairs().details: Returns an array of addresses for each pair that is created

createPair(address,address).details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order If the pair already exists, it raises the PairAlreadyExists error. If both parameters are equal, raises the IdenticalTokens error. If one of the parameters is the zero address, raises the ZeroAddress error. If the oracle does not support the pair, raises the PairNotSupported error.

returns._pair: Address of the newly created pair

params._address: address to test if it is a pair address

returns._isPair: True if address is a pair, false if it is not

pairByTokens(address,address).details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

returns._pair: Address of the pair if found, or zero address if it doesn't exist

IdenticalTokens().notice: Thrown when both tokens are equal

PairAlreadyExists().notice: Thrown when trying to create a pair that already exists

PairCreated(address,address,address).notice: Emitted when a pair is created

allPairs().notice: Gets a list of all available pairs

isPair(address).notice: Checks if address is a pair

pairByTokens(address,address).notice: Gets a pair by a set of tokens
